com.xebialabs.overthere
Interface OverthereFile

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseOverthereFile, ByteArrayFile, LocalFile
public interface OverthereFile

An abstract representation of a file that can be access through an OverthereConnection. It could be a local file or a remote file. It could be accessed from the local machine or through some remote connection methods (e.g. SFTP, CIFS) or read from a repository. A file object can represent a regular file, a directory or some other filesystem object such as links, symbolic links, pipes. It can also represent non-existent file. All methods in this interface may throw a RuntimeIOException if an error occurs. Checked IOExceptions are never thrown.

Method Detail

getConnection

OverthereConnection getConnection()
Return the connection through which this file is accessible. If the connection is closed, this file may no longer be accessible.

Returns:
the connection through which this file is accessible.

getPath

java.lang.String getPath()
Return the full path of the file on the remote system.

Returns:
the full path of the file.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
The name of the file on the remote system.

Returns:
the name of the file.

getParentFile

OverthereFile getParentFile()
Return a reference to the parent of this file or null if this file does not have a parent file. The parent of a regular file is the directory that contains it, the parent of a directory is the directory that contains that directory. A root directory does not have a parent.

Returns:
the parent of this file or null if this file does not have a parent file.

getFile

OverthereFile getFile(java.lang.String child)
Returns a reference to a named child of this file or null if this file is not a directory. The child file returned may or may not exist.

Parameters:
child - the name of the child relative to this file. May not contain path separators.
Returns:
the child of this file or null if this file is not a directory.

exists

boolean exists()
Tests whether the file represented by this object exists.

Returns:
true if and only if this file exists.
Throws:
RuntimeIOException - if an I/O error occured

getInputStream

java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Returns an input stream to read from this file. The complete contents of this input stream must be read before another operation on this file or its corresponding OverthereConnection is performed.

Returns:
an input stream connected to this file.

getOutputStream

java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Returns an output stream to write to this file. The complete contents of this output stream must be written before another operation on this file or its corresponding OverthereConnection is performed.

Returns:
an output stream connected to this file.

setExecutable

void setExecutable(boolean executable)
Sets the execute permission on this file.

Parameters:
executable - If true, sets the access permission to allow execute operations; if false to disallow execute operations.

delete

void delete()
Deletes this file or directory. If this file is a directory and it is not empty, a RuntimeIOException is thrown.

deleteRecursively

void deleteRecursively()
Deletes this file or directory. If this file is a directory, its contents are deleted first.

listFiles

java.util.List<OverthereFile> listFiles()
Lists the files in this directory. If this file is not a directory, the outcome is unspecified.

Returns:
the files in this directory, in an unspecified order.

mkdir

void mkdir()
Creates this directory. If the parent directory does not exists, a RuntimeIOException is thrown.

mkdirs

void mkdirs()
Creates this directory and any of its parent directories.

renameTo

void renameTo(OverthereFile dest)
Renames or moves this file. Usually, a file cannot be moved to a different type of connection and sometimes not even to a different connection. Also, it depends on the connaction implementation whether or not the file can be moved accross file system boundaries within that connection.

Parameters:
dest - the new location for this file.

copyTo

void copyTo(OverthereFile dest)
Copies this file or directory (recursively) to the destination. Contrary to the semantics of renameTo(OverthereFile), a file can be copied accross connections and across file systems withtin a connection.

Parameters:
dest - the file to copy to.
